intro: Codonocephalum stenocalathium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved codonocephalum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
